It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"repay(uint256)":{"details":"If the Escrow's balance of the borrowed token is less than the amount to repay, transfer tokens from the sender's wallet.Only the owner of the Escrow can call this. gets the settings contract address from the SETTINGS_SLOT."}},"notice":"This contract is used by borrowers to call Dapp functions (using delegate calls).This contract should only be constructed using @param dappData the current dapp data to be executed.

devdoc.author: develop@teller.finance
devdoc.details: The current Dapp implementations are: Uniswap and Compound.

calculateTotalValue().return: This Escrow instance total value expressed in ETH and Token value.

params.dappData: the current dapp data to be executed.

claimTokens(address).details: The loan must not be active.The recipient must either be the loan borrower OR the loan must be already liquidated.

params.recipient: address to send the tokens to.

initialize(address).details: Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.

params.aLoanID: the loan ID associated to this escrow instance.

initialized().return: true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

isUnderValued().return: true if this escrow loan is undervalued based on its token price.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

repay(uint256).details: If the Escrow's balance of the borrowed token is less than the amount to repay, transfer tokens from the sender's wallet.Only the owner of the Escrow can call this. If someone else wants to make a payment, they should call the loans contract directly.

settings().details: This address should NOT change over the time. See details in the _setSettings(...) function.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

calculateTotalValue().notice: Calculate this Escrow instance total value.

callDapp((address,bytes)).notice: It calls a given dapp using a delegatecall function by a borrower owned the current loan id associated to this escrow contract.

claimTokens(address).notice: Sends the tokens owned by this escrow to the recipient.

getBorrower().notice: Gets the borrower for this Escrow's loan.

initialize(address,uint256).notice: It initializes this escrow instance for a given loans address and loan id.

initialized().notice: Gets if the contract is initialized.

isUnderValued().notice: Checks if this Escrow loan value is undervalued based its token price.

settings().notice: The gets the settings contract address from the SETTINGS_SLOT.

userdoc.notice: This contract is used by borrowers to call Dapp functions (using delegate calls).This contract should only be constructed using it's upgradeable Proxy contract.In order to call a Dapp function, the Dapp must be added in the EscrowFactory instance.
